March 17, 2020

Dear Pollock Pines ESD Families,

First, I hope everyone is safe and warm. Our current situation is challenging to say the least. The storm has not helped and we continue to monitor the situation and receive guidance from the County Office of Education and the County Public Health Office.

The amount of snow and the power outages have greatly hampered our efforts to provide services during the school closure. We had planned to get staff together to plan work for students and provide resources for families during the outage. We had also planned to provide meals during the outage. The severity of the storm was such that staff could not safely report to work.

At this point, we are in the process of getting access to the schools. Sierra Ridge and the District Office are still without power as of Tuesday, March 17, 2020. We have no estimation at this time of when it might be restored.

I would ask for your patience during this time of uncertainty as we work to do what we can for your children.

Stay Safe,

Pat Atkins

Superintendent

post_text: This morning there was law enforcement activity in the Pollock Pines area as officers were in pursuit of a stolen vehicle from Tahoe. The pursuit and activity was in the area east of Pollock Pines on Highway 50 and Upper Ridgeway. The transportation director was on the phone communicating with Sheriff Dispatch and the Superintendent regarding road closures and re-routing two of our buses as the area was closed to through traffic. During this time a bus driver (Cathy) called in a suspicious suspect in the area of Sly Park near Rocky Road, that we reported to Sheriff dispatch and this lead to the capture of the suspect. During this time we want all parents to know that student safety was our number one priority as we worked through the situation.

Do you like pancakes? Do you like to run? Join in for the first Saturday Pancake Run, Saturday, February 13. The run will begin at Sierra Ridge School at 8:00 am and then run 3 miles to the Pollock Pines Camino Community Center for a quick stop for a delicious pancake. Then after that quick bite, we will continue down Pony Express, turn at the Valero and come back up Lower Ridgeway, to Hazel and then up Amber Trail to the school. (A distance of about 9 miles) If you are a more intrepid runner, you can do an alternate path which will take you up Gold Ridge and then back to school along Kingswood. (Total distance about 13.1 miles)

The pancakes are made by the Sierra Ridge Interact Club and will cost $3.00, which is a very inexpensive run cost. We will leave at 8 am. The gate will be open to allow you to park.

Pancake runs only occur on the Saturdays of the Interact breakfasts.
